beer.beer_description: This deliciously dark oatmeal stout is brewed with a combination of dark malts, roasted barley and oats to give complex roasted flavours and a smooth, creamy mouthfeel. Brewed in honour of Jack Black, the mysterious cobbler of Llareggub, this is the latest in our range of Dylan Thomas inspired beers.

items.badge_description: This velvety smooth, roasty style will take your taste buds to another planet. Oatmeal isn't just for breakfast anymore. That's 145 different beers with the style of Stout - Oatmeal or Stout - Imperial Oatmeal. Try 5 more for Level 30!

items.checkin_comment: Enjoyed at the 2012 Camra Great Welsh Beer Festival

items.badge_description: Porters and Stouts are rich with both history and flavor. Roasty, dark, and delicious, these two styles helped start it all. That’s 175 different beers with the style of Porter or Stout. Try 5 more for Level 36!

items.badge_name: Beyond a Shadow of a Stout (Level 24)
items.badge_description: We all love Stouts, and now we have a dedicated badge to celebrate your dedication to these dark, top-fermented beer in multiple variations, like Oatmeal, Milk and more! Which one will you start with? That's 120 different beers with the style of Stout. Try 5 more for Level 25!
Had enough tea and biscuits? Head to the pub for a pint! That's at least 105 beers from the UK. Try 5 more for Level 22.

While small, the brewing tradition of Wales is quite robust. As early as the 6th century the country began to form its very own distinct styles. That's 5 different beers from a brewery from Wales. Try 5 more for Level 2!

items.checkin_comment: July 8 2017. 500ml bottle @ Goat Major, Cardiff. Pours a clear mahogany, small pale tan head. Aroma of sweet caramel, lightly nutty. Taste is smooth, fairly sweet with good caramel presence, some dusty cocoa and light roast. Ok, bit thin.

items.badge_description: Want to enjoy a day of brews, but need to keep your wits sharp? There are plenty of delicious brews under 5% for you to sip on throughout the day. That's 65 different beers with an ABV of 5% and lower. Try 5 more for Level 14!
